definitions: To rise to a standing position.
To remain valid or strong under scrutiny or testing.
To fail to meet someone for a prearranged date or appointment, especially a romantic one, without explanation.
To defend oneself or another person.
To be resistant to wear or damage.
examples: Please stand up when the judge enters.
His alibi didn't stand up in court.
She was stood up by her date again.
You need to stand up for yourself.
These boots really stand up to harsh weather.
